RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAN OUT OF TRAINER broke clear and angled in to rate the pace, widened at the rail on the turn and was kept alert through the stretch. SHEWONTTALKTOME chased through the backstretch and improved at the rail on the turn, eased to the two path midway through the turn then dueled through the stretch for second. DIRECT THE CAT became anxious leaving the paddock and in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. SOMESUGARNSPICE chased through the backstretch, was carried out entering the turn, angled back to the rail midway through the turn and ran evenly down the lane. ANOTHER FINE JUBA engaged in close early chase but dropped back approaching the quarter pole and weakened in the lane. MISS INTENSITY chased inside but drifted into the turn and showed little in the lane. FULL OF CHARM came away awkwardly then gave chase, was carried out entering the turn and showed little further. HERE'S A QUARTER chased, bore out into the turn then weakened at the rail.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Intensity
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,drifted into turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Somesugarnspice
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,carried out into turn,angled in,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Full of Charm
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,chased,carried out into turn,little further

ENTRY.NAME: Ran Out of Trainer
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke clear,angled in,rated pace,widened rail turn,kept alert

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 6, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THUNDER PUNCH rated a clear lead inside, was urged away at the rail on the turn then steadily handled in the lane. MAKE IT A DOUBLE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and finished well, though, settled for second. DON'T EATTHE APPLE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn just off the rail, flattened inside the sixteenth pole and just lasted for third. AT THE HALF chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn, finished well and just missed third. MARY'S LISTED NEXT came away a bit awkwardly then gave chase, rounded the turn in the three and four paths and weakened in the lane. HAD THE NOTION chased, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Thunder Punch
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated clear inside,urged away rail turn,steady handling lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 92. Starter Allowance Purse 20700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JULY 6, 2021. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entere d For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAGLER settled back off the rail on the opening turn then eased outward into the backstretch, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, drifted into the stretch, dug in to get up the final yards and just lasted. RIDICULOUS steadied into the first turn but recovered stride through the turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, dug in to take second the final yards and just missed the win. JAYJAYDEE steadied into the first turn and settled off the early pace, picked up the chase into the backstretch, raced in the four path on the far turn and finished well while gaining on the top two. ANTIPOISON was bumped, nearly unseating his rider into the first turn but took the lead at the nine sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths but was caught weakening in late stretch. IMPROBABLE STORY rated close to the early pace inside, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole then weakened in the three path of the far turn. DR. RUSTY RAYMOND took a brief lead into the first turn, was caught and gave chase toward the nine sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. BUTTONED UP set the early pace inside but suffered a fatal injury into the first turn and had to be euthanized on the track. The Stewards conducted an inquiry to review the incident into the first turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Hagler
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,eased out 1/2,bid 3/8,drifted 1/8,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Jayjaydee
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied into 1st turn,chased 1/2,4p far turn,gaining on two two

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CUPID'S SONG set a pressured pace while tapering to the inside, raced at the rail on the turn and held well with steady handling. HARLEY SIOUX chased the early pace inside, steadied in tight at the rail approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced hemmed in through the turn, checked at the rail approaching the sixteenth pole but eased outside the winner and dueled ALDARIGHTTRICKS for second. The latter chased outside, raced close in the four path on the turn but was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. SCARE DEM chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and finished well. UNCLE PRESS gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. GAMBLING FEVER pressured the pace through the backstretch but dropped back off the rail approaching the head of the lane and flattened stride. DOCTOR PARDO was sluggish getting into stride, moved to the outside to give chase and rounded the turn in the two and three paths, but showed little more. GOLD FIBER gave chase then weakened in the five and six paths of the turn. IT'S ONLY MONEY lunged at the break, gave chase through the backstretch then weakened in the four path on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Harley Sioux
ENTRY.OWNER: Straughn William E and Thacker Daniel

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Press
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Pardo
ENTRY.COMMENT: sluggish into stride,chased,2& 3p turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Cupid's Song
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Gambling Fever
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRYDA dueled for the lead approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced clear at the quarter, rounded the turn near the rail and was steadily handled in the stretch. KEEP ON SPURRIN chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and finished well while settling for second. CASTLE TOY was bumped at the break then set a pressured early pace, gave chase toward the five sixteenths pole but dropped back at the rail into the turn and flattened stride in the lane. DIXIE YODELER veered outward and made contact with BLUE MOUNTAIN leaving the gate then gave distant chase, rounded the turn about the three path, drifted into the stretch but finished evenly to pass rivals. The latter became edgy in the gate, was bumped outward and into Castle Toy leaving the gate then gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn but showed little in the lane. DREAMY SONDE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, drifted into the stretch and weakened. CHEROKEE CASTLE gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. CHARITABLE ANY became edgy in the gate and stumbled at the break, gave chase outside but was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamy Sonde
ENTRY.OWNER: Pascal Lawrence J and Harding Sr Philip Arthur

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 49. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKIN' GOLD stalked two deep on the first turn then took the lead past the half mile pole, came under pressure at the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the lane. SUMMONING DENIS rated close to the early pace inside, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, drifted to the six path on the far turn but held on for second while flattening stride. JOOBY DOOBY DOO raced well off the pace in the three and four paths, left the first turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and came along for third mid-stretch. MOON FALL rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. CHICKERLING saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. LAST OF BAD BOYS stalked off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. DISCREET LOVE rounded the first turn about the five path and showed little response through the backstretch. DON'T GET CAUGHTUP mostly saved ground. RAISE A RUCKUS had the early lead inside, was met leaving the half mile pole and gave chase from that point, but weakened approaching the five sixteenths. IRISH FLIGHT raced inside through the front stretch but was eased while bearing outward on the first turn and walked off post race.

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Flight
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside early,eased bearing out 1st turn,walked off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 19600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WINDSOR'S PLAY rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole and contested even terms closest to the rail on the far turn, then dug in determinedly through the lane and held on. LADRO DI FICHI saved ground well off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole and improved in the five path of the far turn, finished well to take second the final yards and was gaining on the winner. BEST VIRGINIA stalked three wide the opening turn, challenged leaving the three eighths pole and contested even terms two deep on the far turn, dug in a close factor through the upper stretch but flattened the final sixteenth. MONOCACY settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase toward the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. MISS LAUREN raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, eased out approaching the top of the stretch but flattened stride. MY SISTER PAM raced off the pace in the four path on the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths and showed little further. CEDAR'S WISH saved ground on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. BAYS CASTLE was never a factor. KELSEY'S ANGEL stalked two deep, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. RIVER REWARDS RVF stalked four wide on the first turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Kelsey's Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Metropolitan Thoroughbreds LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Best Virginia
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Conrad Randall R

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Play
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 3/8,even terms turn,determined,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Lauren
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,eased out,flatten

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROAD PARTY took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, contested even terms at the rail on the far turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over the game challenge of PENGUIN PARADE, who stalked two deep on the opening turn, started a three wide bid at the three eighths pole and contested even terms two deep on the far turn, dug in gamely leaving the turn but reluctantly ceded later yards. BOSS E BOOGS was bumped leaving the gate then rated close inside, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. CHANGE YOUR LUCK raced with the pace through the front stretch then stalked into the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but dropped back approaching the five sixteenths and weakened at the rail on the far turn. PAYMENGOLD ducked in and made contact with Boss E Boggs leaving the gate then settled off the rail and showed little response through the backstretch. SPANGLISH saved ground off the pace, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Boss E Boogs
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,rated close inside,chased 7/16,rail turn,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OCEAN STORM raced well off the pace in the five path on the opening turn, left the turn outside and bid approaching the three eighths pole, steadily progressed at the rail on the far turn, took the nod entering the stretch, dueled clear past the eighth pole and was steadily encouraged to hold on. FELICIAS CASTLE settled off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn five wide, dueled for second approaching mid-stretch and finished well. HARPERSGONEFISHING rounded the opening turn about the three path, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole and took a brief lead three wide past the five sixteenths, raced briefly clear midway on the far turn but was met entering the stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. DEVIL'S CANYON saved ground off the pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close four wide on the far turn, lugged inward through the upper stretch and finished evenly. ROCKING TO HOME raced with the pace inside, dueled leaving the three eighths pole, dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and flattened in the lane. SWISS LEGACY raced with the pace two deep while between horses through the front stretch, took a slim lead passing the nine sixteenths pole, dueled from the three eighths but dropped back at the quarter and weakened off the rail on the far turn. BOBBYS CASE LOAD rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the seven path on the far turn and passed some rivals outside. MISTER DEEKS stumbled and hit the gate at the break then never factored. ALLEGHENY HERO rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the five path of the far turn. DRUNK TEXT raced with the pace three wide on the front stretch then stalked into the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, steadied between horses approaching the far turn then faded through the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Rocking to Home
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,dueled from 3/8,dropped back mid turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Devil's Canyon
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,close 4wd far turn,lugged in,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Harpersgonefishing
ENTRY.OWNER: Hasty Rebel Stables LLC and Carlisle Horse Company

ENTRY.NAME: Felicias Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,5wd far turn,dueled 2nd near 1/16,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 5p,bid 3/8,rail far turn,up 1/8,cleared,held on
